unit.utterance: O yos tis kojakaris pu to psarin.
unit.utterance_translation: The son of the old woman of the fish.

unit.utterance: Mian volan ishen mian kojakarin j ishen enan yon.
unit.utterance_translation: One time there was an old woman and she had a son.

unit.utterance: Meran nixtan ethk'akonan j etaizen ton.
unit.utterance_translation: Day and night she begged and fed him.

unit.utterance: Einin dhekapende ghronon pallikarin koma ethk'akonan j etaizen ton.
unit.utterance_translation: He became a young man of fifteen years, still she begged and fed him.

unit.utterance: Thk'a amma o yos su na oki tu andros mu enan patson xeli enan minan na fai psumin je thk'akonas je taizis ton?
unit.utterance_translation: Aunt, when your son slaps my husband, he will need a month to recover, and you beg and feed him?

unit.utterance: Enna men su dhiumen.
unit.utterance_translation: We will stop giving you anything.

unit.utterance: Epien esso lali tu:
unit.utterance_translation: She went home she tells him.

unit.utterance: Ye mu ya onoman tu Theu fere nun stin jefalin su!
unit.utterance_translation: My son, for the name of God, come to your senses!

unit.utterance: En mu dhiun pk'on!
unit.utterance_translation: They don't give me anything anymore!

unit.utterance: Na pais j esu na ghulepsis.
unit.utterance_translation: You too should go and work.

unit.utterance: Mana lali tis amma o jiris mu inda ghul'an ekamnen?
unit.utterance_translation: Mother, he tells her, but my father - what work did he do?

unit.utterance: O jiris su itan psaras ye mu.
unit.utterance_translation: Your father was a fisherman, son.

unit.utterance: E eshi ta dhixtia tu o jiris mu?
unit.utterance_translation: Are my father's nets still there? ((lit.) Does my father have his nets)

unit.utterance: Eshi ta en mes tin arseran.
unit.utterance_translation: Yes, they're in the skylight.

unit.utterance: E kalan!
unit.utterance_translation: Ah, ok!

unit.utterance: Aman en mes stin arseran na ta katevaso je na mu dhiksis inda lois ekamnen o jiris mu na pao j eo sto psarin avrion mana.
unit.utterance_translation: If they're in the skylight, I will bring them down and you show me what my father did, and I'll go fishing tomorrow too, mother.

unit.utterance: Na su ta dhikso ye mu.
unit.utterance_translation: I'll show them to you, son.

unit.utterance: Ekatevasan ta pu tin arseran j andinaksan ta eplinnan ta.
unit.utterance_translation: They brought them down from the skylight and shook them, they washed them.

unit.utterance: Eto ye mu na kratis etsi je na sirnis mes stin thalassa je na ta travas je na fkalli ekso psarka je na pk'ais psarin na pulis na xerumen psumn'a na tromen ye mu.
unit.utterance_translation: That's how, son, hold them like this and throw them into the sea, and pull them so that fish come out, and take the fish and sell them so that we can get bread to eat, son.

unit.utterance: Ei mana.
unit.utterance_translation: Ok, mother.

unit.utterance: Avrion na pao.
unit.utterance_translation: Tomorrow I should go.

unit.utterance: Esikoxiken pu to pornon epien.
unit.utterance_translation: He got up early, he went.

unit.utterance: Aman j epien aniksen ta dhixtia tu esiren ta mes stin thalassa etavrisen mian volan efkalen kamboson.
unit.utterance_translation: Once he went, he spread the nets, threw them into the sea, he pulled once, he got a lot.

unit.utterance: Sire sire ta dhixtia mes stin thalassa eyemosen mian kofinan psarin.
unit.utterance_translation: After throwing the nets a few times into the sea, he filled a big basket with fish.

unit.utterance: Pk'anni tin kofinan pai sto xorkon.
unit.utterance_translation: He takes the basket and goes to the village.

unit.utterance: Pai jame ston kavenen epulisen jindo psarin epk'axen dheka rial'a.
unit.utterance_translation: He goes to the coffee shop, he sold the fish and got ten coins.

unit.utterance: Afiken je kamboson na pari na fai na mairepsi j i mana tu je jini.
unit.utterance_translation: He left also a lot to take and eat, so that his mother too can cook.

unit.utterance: Epien.
unit.utterance_translation: He went.

unit.utterance: E ye mu ekataferes ta?
unit.utterance_translation: So, son, did you make it?

unit.utterance: Ekatafera ta mana.
unit.utterance_translation: I made it, mother.

unit.utterance: Epk'axa dheka rial'a.
unit.utterance_translation: I got ten coins.

unit.utterance: Eyemosa tin kofinan j epk'axa dheka rial'a j efera to je tuton na mairepsis na famen j emis.
unit.utterance_translation: I filled the basket and got ten coins and brought this too, so that you can cook and we too can eat.

unit.utterance: Xa tes efjes mu na shis ye mu.
unit.utterance_translation: Ha, may you have my blessing, son!

unit.utterance: Na fais na pk'is oti xeli i oreksi su je na kratis kala rial'a mes stin punga su.
unit.utterance_translation: You should eat and drink whatever you feel like and take care of the money in your pocket.

unit.utterance: Ekatsan efaan ipk'asin.
unit.utterance_translation: They sat down, ate and drank.

unit.utterance: Pu to pornon na me sikosis nakkon pornon mana j enna pao.
unit.utterance_translation: Wake me up early in the morning, mother, and I will go.

unit.utterance: Ei ye mu na se sikoso.
unit.utterance_translation: Ok son, I will wake you.

unit.utterance: Epien.
unit.utterance_translation: He went.

unit.utterance: Kata pu epien mes stin akran tu parathalassiou evrexin ena psarin isha me to shillon!
unit.utterance_translation: When he went to the end of the beach a fish appeared as big as a dog.

unit.utterance: Esirnen ta dhixtia en epk'annetun.
unit.utterance_translation: He threw the nets, but he couldn't catch it ((lit.) it could not be caught)

unit.utterance: Pale sire pale sire xa xa na vuttisi o nil'os epk'axen to jindo psarin.
unit.utterance_translation: After throwing several times, ha-ha, the young man dove, caught that fish.

unit.utterance: Xa lali tu enje pulo se.
unit.utterance_translation: Ha, he tells it, I'm not going to sell you.

unit.utterance: Enna se sfakso na se fao yoni popse.
unit.utterance_translation: I will slaughter you and eat you tonight myself.

unit.utterance: Sfazi to shizi tin kark'an tu ivren enan xanappin ghruson mesa.
unit.utterance_translation: He slaughters it, tears its heart, he finds a gold vessel inside.

unit.utterance: Pk'anni na to plinni me to neron tis thalassas na to plinni na pan jinda yemata shononni to neron xame eyinin o topos ullon lires!
unit.utterance_translation: He takes it in order to wash it with seawater, to clean it from the blood, he pours the water on the ground, the whole place was filled with money!

unit.utterance: Xa lali en i zisi mu tuti.
unit.utterance_translation: Ha, he says, that's my living.

unit.utterance: Pk'anni tes lires epien oloisha esso.
unit.utterance_translation: He takes the money, he went straight home.

unit.utterance: E ye mu epulises?
unit.utterance_translation: So, son, did you sell?

unit.utterance: Epulisa mana epulisa!
unit.utterance_translation: I sold, mother, I sold!

unit.utterance: Na tin liran je to psarin tuton na to famen.
unit.utterance_translation: Here is the money, and this fish we should eat.

unit.utterance: Mbravo ye mu!
unit.utterance_translation: Well done, son!

unit.utterance: Eshe tes efjes mu.
unit.utterance_translation: Have my blessing.

unit.utterance: Nna mana vura fere je mian potsan krasin!
unit.utterance_translation: Here, mother, run and get a bottle of wine as well!

unit.utterance: Na su fero ye mu yati na men su fero!
unit.utterance_translation: I'll get it for you son, why not?

unit.utterance: Eferen tu krasin.
unit.utterance_translation: She brought him wine.

unit.utterance: Ekatsan na fasin exelen kandilan.
unit.utterance_translation: They sat down to eat, she wanted a glass.

unit.utterance: En xelumen kandilan mana.
unit.utterance_translation: We don't want a glass, mother.

unit.utterance: Krato xanappin.
unit.utterance_translation: I have a vessel.

unit.utterance: Pu to ivres ye mu?
unit.utterance_translation: Where did you find it, son?

unit.utterance: Ivra to mes stin kark'an tu psarku mana.
unit.utterance_translation: I found it inside the fish's heart, mother.

unit.utterance: Yirni to krasin yirni to pa sto tavlin.
unit.utterance_translation: He pours the wine, he pours it onto the table.

unit.utterance: Oi ye mu j enna yini ullon krasha to mandalotavlon.
unit.utterance_translation: No son, for the tablecloth will be drenched in wine!

unit.utterance: En nen krasha mana.
unit.utterance_translation: It's not wine, mother.

unit.utterance: Paratira itan ullon lires!
unit.utterance_translation: She looks, it was all money!

unit.utterance: A en polla kala ye mu.
unit.utterance_translation: Ah, that's very good, son!

unit.utterance: En i zisi mas.
unit.utterance_translation: It's our living.

unit.utterance: Yire neron je plinne to yire eyemosen tin mian ghon'an tu spithk'u tis kojakaris ullon lires o yos tis.
unit.utterance_translation: Pour water and wash, it pour water - the son of the old woman filled a corner of her house with money.

unit.utterance: Ei mana lali tis eyioni enna pk'ao to xanappin mu je na pao peripaton.
unit.utterance_translation: Ok, mother, he tells her, I will take my vessel and go for a walk.

unit.utterance: Na dho kosmon tora pu krato rial'a.
unit.utterance_translation: To see people, now that I have money.

unit.utterance: E na pais ye mu.
unit.utterance_translation: You should go, son.

unit.utterance: Yiati na men pais?
unit.utterance_translation: Why shouldn't you go?

unit.utterance: Epien.
unit.utterance_translation: He went.

unit.utterance: Pai enan xorkon pai allon xorkon epk'aen mian stratan.
unit.utterance_translation: He went to one village, he went to another one, he took a street.

unit.utterance: San epiennen mes ston kambon ton akliron ivren enan palatin vasilikon.
unit.utterance_translation: As he was walking through a barren field, he found a royal palace.

unit.utterance: Itun i kori tu vasilia mes sto yallokluvin me thk'o dhules j eghlepan tin.
unit.utterance_translation: The daughter of the king was in a glass cage and two servants watched over her.

unit.utterance: Epien je jinos.
unit.utterance_translation: He too went.

unit.utterance: Tora pu irten konda stin fundanan lali na katso na pk'o j eo nakkon neron.
unit.utterance_translation: Now that she came close to the fountain, he says, I too shall sit down and drink a little water.

unit.utterance: Epian i dhules na yemosun tes kuzes tis koris tu vasilea.
unit.utterance_translation: The servants went to fill the clay pots of the king's daughter.

unit.utterance: Nna kori kopella lali tis tundo xanappin je yire mu nakkon neron na pk'o.
unit.utterance_translation: Here, girl, is this vessel, he tells her, pour me some water to drink.

unit.utterance: Eyemosen tu to xanappin shononni to xame.
unit.utterance_translation: She fills the vessel for him, he pours it onto the ground.

unit.utterance: Pk'as tes kori tes lires!
unit.utterance_translation: Take the money, girl!

unit.utterance: Panayia mu lali.
unit.utterance_translation: Mother of God!, she says.

unit.utterance: Ksanayemonni to eshonosen to.
unit.utterance_translation: She fills it again, pours it.

unit.utterance: Pk'as tes esu kori jines.
unit.utterance_translation: You take those, girl.

unit.utterance: Panayia mu!
unit.utterance_translation: Mother of God!

unit.utterance: Pai esso.
unit.utterance_translation: She goes home.

unit.utterance: A jira vasilissa ela dhaxame sto palatin na is jinon ton athropon pu kaxete jame stin fundanan eshi enan xanappin je jemonni to je shononni to je yemonni o topos lires.
unit.utterance_translation: Ah lady queen come here to the palace to see that man sitting there at the fountain, he has a vessel and fills it and pours it, and the place fills with money.

unit.utterance: Xore lires pu mas eoken.
unit.utterance_translation: You see the money that he gave us.

unit.utterance: Vura pe tu ra lali tis na rti pano na tu po na umen an mas to puli.
unit.utterance_translation: You run and tell him, she tells her to come upstairs so that I can talk to him, to see if he will sell it to us.

unit.utterance: Epien.
unit.utterance_translation: She went.

unit.utterance: Lali tu:
unit.utterance_translation: She tells him:

unit.utterance: Pulis mas tundo xanappin?
unit.utterance_translation: Will you sell us this vessel?

unit.utterance: A lali tis nda potte ine dhinaton ? na puliso to xanappin mu pu pk'anno tosin liran?
unit.utterance_translation: Ah, he tells her, is it ever possible that I sell my vessel from which I earn so much money?

unit.utterance: Enj eshi pokopin to xanappin mu!
unit.utterance_translation: My vessel is invaluable!

unit.utterance: An kailisis je ppeso tris nixtes mita su na su to dhoko!
unit.utterance_translation: If you give it to me and sleep three nights with me, I'll give it to you!

unit.utterance: E kailizo lali tu.
unit.utterance_translation: Ah, I give in, she tells him.

unit.utterance: Eppesen tris nixtes to kopellin me tin korin tu vasilea pu tun mes sto yallokluvin j epk'aen to xanappin.
unit.utterance_translation: The young man slept three nights with the daughter of the king who was in the glass cage, and she got the vessel.

unit.utterance: Emba mera efka mera to kopellin yiru-triiru konda tis j eghlepen tin.
unit.utterance_translation: Day in, day out the young man was hanging around her and watched over her.

unit.utterance: E i kopellua itun agastromeni!
unit.utterance_translation: And the girl was pregnant!

unit.utterance: Ra inda n ponna kamumen?
unit.utterance_translation: Hey you, what are we going to do?

unit.utterance: Na to pumen tis vasilissas.
unit.utterance_translation: We should tell the queen.

unit.utterance: J inda enna mas pojefalisi je tus thk'o!
unit.utterance_translation: And then what? She will behead both of us!

unit.utterance: Irten o mairas eferen tus pramata ponna mairefkun na tron.
unit.utterance_translation: The cook came and brought them things so that they can cook and eat.

unit.utterance: Na tis pi tis vasilissas avrion dixos allon na rti dhapano je xelun tin i dhules na tis pis.
unit.utterance_translation: He should tell the queen to come up here tomorrow without fail because the servants want her, you tell her.

unit.utterance: Kalan!
unit.utterance_translation: Ok!

unit.utterance: Epien.
unit.utterance_translation: He went.

unit.utterance: A jira vasilissa i kopellues eminisasin dhixos allon na pais je xelun se.
unit.utterance_translation: Ah, lady queen, the girls say that you should go without fail for they want you.

unit.utterance: O kati epaxen i kopellua ajapa?
unit.utterance_translation: Oh, perhaps something happened to the girl?

unit.utterance: En ixero.
unit.utterance_translation: I don't know.

unit.utterance: Xate na zeksete to kapriolen na pao lali.
unit.utterance_translation: Come harness the cabriolet so that I can go, she says.

unit.utterance: Ezeksan to kapriolen epien i vasilissa fkenni pano xori tin korin tis katavarin!
unit.utterance_translation: They harnessed the cabriolet, the queen went, went upstairs, she sees her daughter heavily pregnant!

unit.utterance: Kori mu lali tis j exumen se mes sto yiallokluvin j evrexis agastromeni?
unit.utterance_translation: Daughter, she tells her, but we keep you inside a glass cage, and now you're pregnant?

unit.utterance: Inda n ponna po tu jiru su tora?
unit.utterance_translation: What am I going to tell your father now?

unit.utterance: Inda ksero lali tis.
unit.utterance_translation: What do I know, she tells her.

unit.utterance: Strefete pai lali tu:
unit.utterance_translation: She goes back and tells him:

unit.utterance: I kori su en agastromeni axendi mu vasilea mu.
unit.utterance_translation: Your daughter is pregnant, my master, my king.

unit.utterance: Agastromeni pon mes sto yallokluvin?
unit.utterance_translation: Pregnant, when she in that glass cage?

unit.utterance: En agastromeni!
unit.utterance_translation: She is pregnant!

unit.utterance: Xate na fonakso tis Dhodhekadhas na tin pojefaliso.
unit.utterance_translation: So I'll call the dozen, I'll behead her.

unit.utterance: Efonaksan tis Dhodhekadhas na rti na tin pojefalisi o vasileas tin korin tu.
unit.utterance_translation: They called the dozen to come, so that the king can behead his daughter.

unit.utterance: E i Dhodhekadha eskeftin.
unit.utterance_translation: So the dozen thought about it.

unit.utterance: Lali tu:
unit.utterance_translation: She tells him:

unit.utterance: Na tin pojefalisumen!
unit.utterance_translation: Suppose we behead her!

unit.utterance: An en agastromeni j en thk'o ta mora lali tu na kataripsumen tris fores?
unit.utterance_translation: If she is pregnant and there are two babies, she tells him, we would waste three lives.

unit.utterance: Ine pk'o kallittera na kamis mian kasonan san to spitin lali tu na tin karfosis kala je na tis valis mesa trofi na tis valis ruxa ponna yennisi ta mora je na tin sirumen mes sto parayalin lali tu j ais tin na katakofkete mes sto neron para na tin pojefalisumen j en kriman!
unit.utterance_translation: It's better if you make a box big like a house, she tells him, nail it well together and put food and clothes inside for when she gives birth to the babies, and we throw her into the sea, she tells him, and let her suffer in the water, better than beheading her, that would be a pity!

unit.utterance: Etsi itan.
unit.utterance_translation: So it was.

unit.utterance: Evalen pelekanus mani mani ekaman tu enan spitin j evalan tin mesa evalan tis psumnia nera faya ruxa esiran tin mes sto parayalin.
unit.utterance_translation: He employed carpenters, quickly they built him a house and put her inside, they put bread, water, food and clothes in it for her and threw her into the sea.

unit.utterance: To kopellin tapison tis jinos pu shen to xanappin.
unit.utterance_translation: The young man followed her, the one that had the vessel.

unit.utterance: Pai perni tin to jimman chush pale ferni tin piso pale perni tin to jimman pale ferni tin piso i kopellua eyennisen ekamen enan yon.
unit.utterance_translation: There she goes, the waves take her, bring her back, take her, bring her back, the girl gave birth, she had a boy.

unit.utterance: Xa poji xa poa tin kasonan efkalen tin ekso o kopellos tis chakkizi tin kasonan vkalli tin estalijen jame ekamen enan konajin triperaton.
unit.utterance_translation: With effort the young man took the box out, he cracks it, takes her out, he settled there, built a huge villa.

unit.utterance: Antis pu itun ipsos evalasin lires j ekaman to pokso posso lires.
unit.utterance_translation: Instead of using plaster, they used money and pasted it inside and outside with money.

unit.utterance: I strata pu parpaten itun plakomeni lires.
unit.utterance_translation: The road where he walked was plastered with coins.

unit.utterance: E akusen to o veziris.
unit.utterance_translation: So the vizier heard about it.

unit.utterance: Ston tathe topon ishen enan konajin n anefanis je na pais na dhis xambonni to fos su!
unit.utterance_translation: At such and such a place there is a villa, show up there, go and see, you will be amazed!

unit.utterance: Posso pokso en ullon lires xtizmenon.
unit.utterance_translation: Inside and outside it is all built with gold.

unit.utterance: Epien is ton vasilean.
unit.utterance_translation: He went to the king.

unit.utterance: Lali tu:
unit.utterance_translation: He tells him:

unit.utterance: Xelo na su po katiti afendi mu vasilea mu ma n iksero je siura.
unit.utterance_translation: I want to say something to you, my master, my king, but I'm not so sure if I should.

unit.utterance: Inda m boni?
unit.utterance_translation: What is it?

unit.utterance: Is ton tadhe topon konda sto parayalin extistin enan palatin posso pokso en lires ipasin enj idha to.
unit.utterance_translation: At such and such a place near to the seaside, a palace was built, inside and outside covered in gold, they said, I myself have not seen it.

unit.utterance: Je an ine dhinaton na pao na paratiriso je na rto na se pk'ao je na pamen avrion.
unit.utterance_translation: And if it is possible, I will go and have a look, and then come and get you, so that we can go tomorrow.

unit.utterance: Esu na pais lali tu.
unit.utterance_translation: You go, he tells him.

unit.utterance: Pai o veziris paratira *inda na i!
unit.utterance_translation: The vizier goes there, looks around, and what does he see!

unit.utterance: Enan konajin posso pokso ologhruson.
unit.utterance_translation: A villa that is inside and outside all golden.

unit.utterance: I kopellua anaghnorisen ton vezirin amma o veziris en anaghnorisen tin kopelluan.
unit.utterance_translation: The girl recognized the vizier, but the vizier did not recognize the girl.

unit.utterance: Embiken esso ejerasan tu etrattaran tu.
unit.utterance_translation: He entered the house, they treated him.

unit.utterance: E inda xaparka pu to xorkon sas?
unit.utterance_translation: So, what are your news from the village? (MV)

unit.utterance: Kalan!
unit.utterance_translation: All well!

unit.utterance: Akusan tundo palatin pu ghiniken dhaame je ipun to tu vasilea je epepsen me na to dho j an nen dhinaton avrion enna rtumen pale me ton vasilean je me tin vasilissan na dhi to konajin.
unit.utterance_translation: They heard about this palace that was built here, and I told the king about it, and he sent me here to see it, and when possible, tomorrow we will come together with the king and the queen so that he can look at the villa.

unit.utterance: As kalosorisi ipen.
unit.utterance_translation: He is welcome, she said.

unit.utterance: Aman je ishosen o veziris ji xate ghliora na pa na feris faita lali tu na kamumen tu patera mas zhafettin.
unit.utterance_translation: When the vizier set off, quickly go and get food, said she, so that we can have a party for our father.

unit.utterance: Epien to kopellin eferen po ulla ta pramata.
unit.utterance_translation: The young man went, brought back all sorts of things.

unit.utterance: Emairepsan esasan ta nasu je ton vasilean me tin vasilissan je me ton vezirin je me tin vezirenan to proeman ekatevikan is to palatin jinon.
unit.utterance_translation: They cooked, tidied up, here comes the king with the queen, the vizier, and his wife, they came to the palace in the morning.

unit.utterance: Evalen tus ta trapezha na fasin andis na tus vali tin kandilan evalen to xanappin na pinnun krasin na pinnun to pk'otin tus.
unit.utterance_translation: She set the table for them to eat, but instead of offering them the pot, she put the vessel there so that they could drink, so that they could have a drink.

unit.utterance: Yiati kori mu lali tis en eshi kandilan?
unit.utterance_translation: But young lady he tells her, isn't there a glass?

unit.utterance: Oi tuti en kallitteri pu tin kandilan afendi mu vasilea mu lali tu.
unit.utterance_translation: No, this is better than a glass, my master, my king, she tells him.

unit.utterance: Ivren tin pinn'an shononni to:
unit.utterance_translation: She got the drink and started pouring it:

unit.utterance: Oi pedhin mu lali tis enna kamis ta trapezomandila su ullon krasin.
unit.utterance_translation: No, my child, he tells her, you will drench your tablecloths in wine.

unit.utterance: En yenonde krasin lali tu.
unit.utterance_translation: They won't be drenched in wine, she tells him.

unit.utterance: Einiken lires!
unit.utterance_translation: It turned into money!

unit.utterance: Pinni enas shononni to lires ombros tu allu.
unit.utterance_translation: One of them drinks, he pours it into gold in front of the other.

unit.utterance: Xa lali tis pulite mu tunto xanappin?
unit.utterance_translation: Ha, he tells her, will you sell this vessel to me?

unit.utterance: Pulo su to lali i kori.
unit.utterance_translation: I'll sell it to you, says the daughter.

unit.utterance: E je posa xelete?
unit.utterance_translation: And how much do you want?

unit.utterance: Nda enj en me ta rial'a!
unit.utterance_translation: It's not about money!

unit.utterance: Kalo?
unit.utterance_translation: What then?

unit.utterance: Ela na pamen podhoththe na su po lali tu.
unit.utterance_translation: Let's go aside and I will tell you, she says.

unit.utterance: Olan na su to puliso!
unit.utterance_translation: What the heck I'll sell it to you!

unit.utterance: Epiren ton allo spitin lali tu:
unit.utterance_translation: She took him to another house, she tells him:

unit.utterance: Thk'as mu nakkon kolon me sixxoris lali tu je na su to dhoko?
unit.utterance_translation: Would you give me a little ass, excuse me, she tells him, and I will give it to you?

unit.utterance: Thk'o su to lali tis.
unit.utterance_translation: I'll give it to you, he tells her.

unit.utterance: Epien na fkali ta ruxa eftisen tu i kopellua:
unit.utterance_translation: He started taking off his clothes, the girl spat at him:

unit.utterance: Ftu su lali tu esu pu se jiris mu lali tu je aresen su j enna okis ton kolon su pu se vasileas j eo pu to idha lali tu evala ton tris nixtes eplayasen mita mu j epk'aa to xanappin tuton j ekama ton andran mu lali tu.
unit.utterance_translation: I spit at you, she tells him, you that are my father, she tells him, and you liked it, and you will offer your ass although you're a king, and I, when I saw it, she tells him, I put him three nights to lie next to me and got this vessel, and made him my husband, she tells him.

unit.utterance: Ma ise i kori mu?
unit.utterance_translation: But are you my daughter?

unit.utterance: Ime i kori su!
unit.utterance_translation: I am your daughter

unit.utterance: A mbravo tora ekatalava.
unit.utterance_translation: Ah, you're right, now I understand.

unit.utterance: Xate saranda meres ghamon saranda nixtes ghamon armasen tin korin tu o vasileas me to kopellin jinon pu ekraten to xanappin to ghruson pu eshononnen lires.
unit.utterance_translation: So after forty days wedding and forty nights wedding, the king married his daughter with that young man that had the golden vessel which poured money.

unit.utterance: Efika tus jinus ji kaka j irta j ivra sas esas dha kala.
unit.utterance_translation: I left them there in a bad state and came and found you here in a good one.
